SUBJECT: Raising of Funds
DETAILS: JSW Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company in its meeting held on July 27, 2016 had approved to raise long term funds through the issuance of non-convertible foreign currency/Rupee denominated senior unsecured fixed rate bonds upto USD 750 million (the "Notes"), in one or more tranches, in the international market(s) either by the Company or by any of its overseas subsidiaries backed by corporate guarantee of the Company. The Company now further has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the powers delegated to the finance committee by the Board of Directors of the Company in its meeting held on July 27, 2016, the finance committee has in its meeting held on March 29, 2017 approved the preliminary offering circular in relation to the Notes issuance by the Company. The Company has appointed intermediaries for organizing investor meetings for the probable foreign currency denominated bonds. The bond offering may follow, subject to market conditions.

SUBJECT: Reply to Clarification Sought

Name of the target entity, details in brief such as size, turnover etc;2. Whether the acquisition would fall within related party transactions and whether the promoter/ promoter group/ group companies have any interest in the entity being acquired? If yes, nature of interest and details thereof and whether the same is done at "arm's length";3. Objects and effects of acquisition4. Brief details of any governmental or regulatory approvals was required for the acquisition;5. Brief background about the entity acquired in terms of products/line of business acquired, date of incorporation, history of last 3 years turnover, country in which the acquired entity has presence and any other significant information (in brief).The response of the Company is attached.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: JSW Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that as a certified copy of the order has since been received from the Hon'ble High Court, we hereby Inform you that the Hon'ble High Court of Karnataka has on December 03, 2015 delivered its Judgement In response to a petition filed by mine owners and the purchasers of iron ore Including JSW Steel Limited on the levy of Forest Development Tax (FDT) by the State of Karnataka, with a partial relief on the payment of FDT.The Parties are entitled to appeal to the Hon'ble Supreme Court within the stipulated period of limitation of 90 days.The Company is closely monitoring the developments In this regard.

SUBJECT: Clarification
DETAILS: JSW Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that  JSW Steel USA Inc., a subsidiary of JSW Steel Limited has been contesting an appeal in the United States Court of Appeals for the fifth circuit. It is learnt that decision has been pronounced by the US Court against our subsidiary.JSW Steel USA Inc., is disappointed with the decision by the US Court and respectfully disagrees with its conclusions. The Company is studying and analysing the judgement in detail and evaluating all options available to defend its position under the applicable laws.

DETAILS: JSW Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on May 15, 2015 has recommended i. Dividend at the stipulated rate of Re.1/- ( Rupee One only) per share on the 10% Cumulative Redeemable Preference Shares of Rs.10 each of the Company has been recommended for the year ended March 31, 2015; and ii. Dividend of Rs.11/- (Rupees Eleven only) (110%) per fully paid-up Equity Share of Rs. 10 each has been recommended for the year ended March 31, 2015. SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from JSW Steel Limited with respect to news item captioned "Sajjan Jindal-led JSW Steel to shut Chile mines for now". The Company has clarified that  JSW Steel Limited (JSWSL)'s step-down subsidiary, Santa Fe Mining (SFM) has rights to develop the iron ore deposits in the Atacama region of Chile. JSWSL holds 70% stake in SFM through its indirect Chilean subsidiary Inversions Eurosh Limitada (IEL).   As the international iron ore prices fell substantially in the last 12 months, SFM has been evaluating the option of taking temporary shutdown in May 2015. Simultaneously, SFM is also working on reducing costs to make mining operations viable .

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from JSW Steel Limited with respect to a news item captioned "JSW gives up on steel power plant in Bengal". The Company has clarified that "Besides Iron Ore linkage for this project, the recent cancellation of Coal Mining Concessions has added further uncertainty. Hence this project is currently put on hold".

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from JSW Steel Limited with respect to a news item captioned "JSW Steel Charts Local Expansion Plan, Defer Investment in Italy". The Company has clarified that "As a long term strategy, JSW Steel plans to expand its steel capacity to 40MTPA by 2025 by means of brownfield and greenfield expansion and also through acquisitions. Accordingly, the Company is currently implementing capacity expansion project from 14.3 mtpa to 16.3 mtpa. In line with company's long term strategy, the capacity expansion projects will be taken up in phase collaborating with the supply and demand dynamics and will be intimated once these plans are firmed up. The Company has evaluating several options including slurry pipeline linking Vijayanagar to Jaigarh Port for sourcing of raw materials at optimal cost. The Company continues to scan forward and backward integration opportunities overseas including Italy for its steel making operations in India. We note to keep the Exchange informed if there are any material developments in this regards in compliance with clause 36 of the Listing Agreement".

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that  "JSW Steel to acquire Bhushan Steel Odisha steel unit." . The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the company. Reply is awaited from JSW Steel Limited.

SUBJECT: News Clarification
DETAILS: The Exchange had sought clarification from JSW Steel Limited with respect to a news item captioned "JSW Steel wants to pay promoter's wife for brand promotion". The Company has clarified that "In this connection, we would like to Inform you that JSW Investments Pvt Limited, is the owner of the brand 'JSW'. To sustain and improve the brand value and to bestow the tangible and Intangible benefits In the longer term, a sustainable corporate branding campaign Involving substantial expenditure has to be done on consistent basis to disseminate the Idea, knowledge, information and core values of the brand through a systematic campaign.    To meet this expenditure, a brand fee is proposed which is benchmarked with that of fees being paid by various conglomerates in India and abroad. Appropriate checks and balances are put in place so that the brand fee paid by various companies of the Group is used for the purpose intended duly certified by independent auditors.    The transaction being a related party transaction under the provisions of the Companies Act, 2013 has the approval of the Audit Committee, the Board of Directors of the Company and as announced by the Chairman at the Company's 20th Annual General Meeting held on 31.07.2014, also that of the Shareholders of the Company.    There is nothing unusual or abusive in this transaction and JSW Steel adheres to best corporate governance practices in all its actions".

SUBJECT: Scheme of Arrangement
DETAILS: JSW Steel Limited ("The Company") has informed the Exchange as follows : The Company has fixed June 12, 2013 as the record date (the "Record Date") for the purpose of drawing up the list of shareholders of JSW Ispat Steel Limited (JSWISL) to whom equity shares and 0.01% cumulative redeemable preference shares of the Company will be issued and allotted pursuant to and in terms of the Scheme. In terms of the sanctioned Scheme, the shareholders of the transferor company i.e. JSWISL will be issued shares of the Company in the following ratio: (1) For every 72 (Seventy Two) fully paid-up equity shares of face value of Rs.10/- (Rupees Ten Only) each held in JSWISL, as on the Record Date, every equity shareholder of JSWISL will be entitled to receive 1 (One) equity share of face value of Rs.10/- (Rupees Ten only) each of the Company, credited as fully paid-up; and (2) For every 1 (One) 0.01% fully paid-up cumulative redeemable preference share of face value of Rs.10/- (Rupees Ten only) each held in JSWISL, as on the Record Date, every 0.01% cumulative redeemable preference shareholder of JSWISL will be entitled to receive 1 (one) 0.01% cumulative redeemable preference share of face value of Rs.10/- (Rupees Ten only) each of the Company, having the same rights and terms, and credited as fully paid-up.

SUBJECT: Change in Director(s)

May 23, 2013 in place of Mr. Y. Kurokawa. Mr. Hiromu is the Sr. Vice President, Facilities Planning Department, Technical Co-operation Department and Corporate planning Dept, India JSW Project Team. (2) Dr. Vinod Nowal, Wholetime Director of the Company, hitherto designated as Director & CEO has been re-designated as Dy. Managing Director.

SUBJECT: Book Closure

(b) Payment of Dividend on the Equity Shares of Rs.10 each of the Company, for the year ended March 31, 2013; and (c) Annual General Meeting.

SUBJECT: Dividend
DETAILS: JSW Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on May 23, 2013 has approved : (1) Dividend at the stipulated rate of Re.1/- (Rupees One Only) per share on the 10% Cumulative Redeemable Preference Shares of Rs.10/- each of the Company has been recommended for the year ended March 31, 2013 and (2) Dividend of Rs.10/- (Rupees Ten only) (100%) per fuly paid-up Equity Share of Rs.10 each has been recommended for the year ended March 31, 2013.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the meeting of the Board of Directors of the Company (the "Board") held on September 01 2012, the Board has considered and unanimously approved a 'Composite Scheme of Arrangement and Amalgamation' under Sections 391-394 of the Companies Act 1956 (the "Scheme) among the Company, JSW Ispat Steel Limited ("JSW Ispat"), JSW Building Systems Ltd. ("JSW Building"), Maharashtra Sponge Iron Ltd ("Maharashtra Sponge") and their respective shareholders and creditors relating to the following matters (to be effected in the sequence set forth hereinbelow):  (a) transfer of the 'Kalmeshwar' undertaking of JSW Ispat to Maharashtra Sponge (an indirect wholly owned subsidiary of the Company).  (b) transfer of the 'Vasind' and 'Tarapur' undertaking of the Company to Maharashtra Sponge.  (c) amalgamation of JSW Building (a wholly owned subsidiary of the Company) with the Company.  (d) amalgamation of the JSW Ispat with the Company, pursuant to which the shareholders of the JSW Ispat will be entitled to shares of the Company as under:. (i) The equity shareholders of the JSW Ispat will be entitled to 1 (One) equity share face value Rs. 10/-(Rupees Ten Only) each of the Company for every 72 (Seventy Two) fully paid up equity shares of Rs. 10/-(Rupees Ten Only) each of JSW Ispat held by them ("Share Exchange Ratio"); and  (ii) The preference shareholders of the JSW Ispat will be entitled to 1 (One) fully paid up non-convertible cumulative redeemable preference share of face value Rs 10/-(Rupees Ten Only) each of the Company for every 1 (One) fully paid up cumulative redeemable preference share of face value Rs. 10/-(Rupees Ten Only) each of JSW Ispat held by them.  With this regard Company has also submitted a copy of Press Release dated September 01, 2012 titled " Merger Catapults JSW Steel to Top League in Indian Steel Sector"

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited had informed the Exchange regarding the allotment of 1,75,00,000 (One Crore Seventy Five Lakh) warrants on a Preferential basis, to a Promoter Group Entity. JSW Steel Ltd has now informed Exchange that as per the terms of issue of these warrants, upon payment of Exercise Price of Rs. 1,210 per warrant, as reduced by the 25% upfront money paid at the time of allotment of warrants, the warrant holder was entitled to apply for and obtain allotment of One Equity Share of par value of Rs. 10 each against each warrant held. The last date for the exercise of the conversion right of the Warrant holder was December 15, 2011 (within 18 months from the date of their allotment). Further the Company has informed that, the Warrant Holder (Promoter Group Entity) has not exercised its option to convert the aforesaid 1,75,00,000 warrants allotted to it, into Equity shares of the Company. The amount of Rs. 529,37,50,000 being the initial 25% of the total consideration of Rs. 2117,50,00,000/- received by the Company has been forfeited.

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports that JFE Steel may pick up stake in an integrated steel plant of JSW Steel Limited. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the company. JSW Steel Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated,"The company had entered into Strategic collaboration agreement on 19th Nov 2009 with JFE Steel Corporation which includes "Project for building and operating an integrated steel production facility in West Bengal". The company will be taking up active implementation of West Bengal Project on receipt of requisite approvals. Even though JFE has shown interest to participate in the project, the company will decide on the subject at appropriate time."

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at its meeting held on May 16, 2011, inter alia, has transacted the following : (1) Augmenting Crude Steel Capacity to 12mtpa at Vijayanagar Works : The Board reviewed the progress of the on-going Capital Expenditure programmes and status of tie up of resources. The Rationale for next phase of expansion to 12 MTPA from 10 MTPA at Vijayanagar Works was discussed. Considering the growing demand for steel in India, faster Brownfield expansions at low specific investment cost per tonne, the Board approved to take up Brownfield expansion at the Company's Vijayanagar Works at an estimated cost of Rs. 2,695 crores so as to augment the Crude Steel Capacity to 12 mtpa. The projects are expected to be completed by June 30, 2013. The cost of the project is to be financed by way of cash accruals to the extent of Rs. 945 crores and balance through Debt. (2) Change in Company's Directorate - Mr. Yasushi Kurokawa has been appointed as the Nominee Director of JFE Steel Corporation, Japan on the Board of the Company w.e.f. May 16, 2011 in place of Mr. Shigeru Ogura. Mr. Kurokawa is the Sr. Vice President, Corporate planning Dept-India JSW Project Team, Technical Co-operation Department, Controller Department and Auditing Department of JFE Steel Corporation.

SUBJECT: Updates
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange regarding the outcome of the board meeting held on January 27, 2011 : Acquisition of assets of 0.5 MTPA Integrated Steel Plant division of Bellary Steel & Alloys Limited : The Company has been successfully through open bidding process to acquire assets of Integrated Steel Plant division of Bellary Steel & Alloys Limited under the provisions of the Securitisation  Reconstruction of Financial Assets & Enforcement of Security Interest Act, 2002. The Company has paid final consideration aggregating to Rs.210 crores towards the acquisition of land, building and plant & machinery of the partially completed 0.5 mtpa integrated steel plant. The Company is yet to obtain possession of these assets due to certain pending litigations. The Board ratified the actions of the Company taken for the purchase of the assets.

The equity shares underlying the GDRs have been issued at a price of Rs.1500 each. The underlying equity shares rank pari-passu inter-se and with the existing shares of the Company in all respects. Consequent to the aforesaid allotments, the paid-up equity share capital of the Company stands increased form Rs.219,05,34,800/- to Rs. 223,11,72,000 comprising of 22,31,17,200 equity shares of Rs.10/- each.

SUBJECT: Redemption
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that "Pursuant to the Scheme of Amalgamation of Southern Iron and Steel Company Limited (SISCOL) with JSW Steel Limited (JSWSL) and their respective Shareholders & Creditors (the "Scheme") sanctioned by the Hon'ble Bombay High court vide its order dated 22.02.2008, the Company had allotted 99,00,000, 11% Cumulative Redeemable Preference Shares of Rs.10 each (11% CRPS) aggregating to Rs. 9,90,00,000/- on 28.03.2008 in lieu of the 11% CRPS of the erstwhile SISCOL. These Shares are redeemable from the 3rd to the 5th year of their allotment in SISCOL (7th March 2007), at a premium of 10% along with dividend accrued upto the date of redemption. JSWSL's liability to these Preference Shareholders shall stand extinguished from the date of dispatch of the cheques/pay order for the redemption amount along with dividend". Further the Company has informed that, the Board of Directors has by means of a Circular resolution passed on February 17, 2010, accorded its consent for the redemption of the aforesaid 99,00,000, 11% CRPS of Rs. 10 each, aggregating to Rs. 9,90,00,000/-, at a premium of Re. 1 per share (10%), on March 08, 2010, out of the profits of the Company alongwith Dividend for the Current year at the stipulated rate of 11% per annum upto the date of redemption. The details of the same shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that at the meeting of the Board of Directors of the Company held on May 28, 2009, the Board has decided to seek an enabling approval from the Members in the ensuing Annual General Meeting of the Company, for raising of additional long term resources to part finance the Company's Capex and/or for other General Corporate purposes including reducing the leverage, depending on market dynamics, through : 1) The Issue of Equity Shares and/or Securities convertible into Equity Shares to Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIB) in one or more tranches through a Qualified Institutional placement (QIP), not exceeding US $ 1 Billion (United States Dollar One Billion only) or its Indian Rupee equivalent in the aggregate; and /or 2) The Issue of Foreign Currency Convertible Bonds (FCCBs)/ Global Depository Receipts (GDRs)/ American Depository Receipts(ADRs)/ warrants and/ or other instruments convertible into Equity Shares, optionally or otherwise, in one or more tranches, not exceeding US $ 1 Billion (United States Dollar One Billion only) in the aggregate, in the International Capital Market such that the total amount to be raised vide both of the above proposed issues would not in the aggregate exceed a sum of US$ 1 Billion (United States Dollars One Billion only) or its Indian Rupee Equivalent inclusive of such premium as may be determined by the Board.

SUBJECT: Postal Ballot
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the provisions of Section 192A of the Companies Act, 1956 read with Companies (Passing of the Resolution by Postal Ballot) Rules, 2001 to transact the following business by the Members of the Company by passing resolutions through Postal Ballot: (1) Alteration to the Objects Clause of the Memorandum of Association of the Company; and (2) Commencement of all or any of the business specified in sub-clause 100 of clause III C (Objects clause) of the Memorandum of Association of the Company as altered. The Board of Directors of the Company has appointed Mr. Prem Rajani, of M/s Rajani Associates, Advocate and Solicitors, Mumbai as the Scrutinizer, for conducting the Postal Ballot Process in a fair and transparent manner. The Postal Ballot Form duly completed and signed should reach the Scrutinizer not later than the close of working hours on June 27, 2008. Postal Ballot Form received after this date will be treated as if the reply from such Member(s) has not been received. Voting rights shall be reckoned on the paid up value of the shares registered in the name(s) of the Shareholder(s)/Beneficial Owner(s) on the cut off date, that is May 09, 2008. The results of the Postal Ballot Form will be announced on July 01, 2008. A copy of notice of postal ballot shall be available on the NSE website (http://www.nseindia.com) under: Corporates > Latest Announcements and on the Extranet Server (/Common/Corporate Announcements). For more details click here.

SUBJECT: Subsidiary
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that at the Board meeting held on May 05, 2008 the following decisions were taken: "Formation of a Subsidiary in the area of Pre-Engineered Steel Buildings: Pre-Engineered steel buildings(PEBs) are gaining momentum in India. The Indian Corporates implementing large projects are increasingly using the Pre-Engineered steel buildings due to the distinct advantage of saving in construction time of about 30 to 50% in total project schedule, better look and durability. Considering the same the Board has approved the proposal to set up a subsidiary Company, to manufacture and sell Pre-Engineered building structures. The PEBs will consume steel plates, galvanised, colour coated and galvaume products thus giving a captive buyer for JSW Steel. In addition, this will be an opportunity for JSW Steel to enter into high-end solutions using Steel products as the base".

SUBJECT: Book Closure
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that May 23, 2008 to May 27, 2008 (both days inclusive) has been fixed as the Book Closure period for the purpose of determining the eligible shareholders for the: (a) Payment of dividend at the stipulated rate of 10% on the 27,90,34,907,   10% Cumulative Redeemable Preference Shares of Rs.10 each of the Company, for the year ended March 31, 2008; (b) Payment of dividend at the stipulated rate of 11% on the 99,00,000, 11% Cumulative Redeemable Preference shares of Rs.10 each of the Company, for the year ended March 31, 2008 along with arrears for the period March 10, 2007 to March 31, 2007; and (c) Payment of Dividend at the rate of 140% amounting to Rs.14 per Equity Share on the 18,70,48,635 Equity shares of Rs.10 each of the Company for the year ended March 31, 2008.(d) Annual General Meeting.

SUBJECT: Dividend
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that at the Board Meeting held on May 05, 2008, the following decisions were taken: (1) Dividend at the stipulated rate of 10% on the 27,90,34,907,   10% Cumulative Redeemable Preference Shares of Rs.10 each & 11% on the 99,00,000, 11% Cumulative Redeemable Preference shares of Rs.10 each (11%CRPS) along with arrears for the period March 10, 2007 to March 31, 2007 on the said 11% CRPS of the Company has been recommended for the year ended March 31, 2008. (2) Dividend at the rate of 140% amounting to Rs.14 per Equity Share on the 18,70,48,635 Equity shares of Rs.10 each of the Company has been recommended for the year ended March 31, 2008.

SUBJECT: Allotment of Equity Shares
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that: "The Share Allotment Committee of Directors has in its meeting held on 28.03.2008, allotted: 1) 15,00,000 (Fifteen lacs) equity shares of Rs. 10 each, fully paid up, to Mr. Sajjan Jindal & 65,00,000 (Sixty Five Lacs) Equity Shares of Rs. 10 each fully paid up to JSW Investments Pvt Limited (formerly known as Samarth Holdings Private Limited) upon exercise of option attached to equivalent number of 'Series B' Warrants held by them. 2) 1,50,35,712 (One Crore fifty lacs thirty five thousand seven hundred twelve) Equity Shares of Rs.10/- each fully paid up; and 99,00,000 (ninety nine lacs) 11% Cumulative Redeemable Preference Shares of Rs. 10/- each, fully paid up to the Equity & Preference shareholders of Southern Iron & Steel Co. Limited respectively, whose name appears in its Register of Members/ Register of Preference Shareholders on 25.03.2008 being the Record Date fixed for the purpose, pursuant to the Scheme of Amalgamation of Southern Iron & Steel Co. Limited (SISCOL) with JSW Steel Limited sanctioned by the Hon'ble High Court of Judicature at Mumbai on 22.02.2008. Consequent to the aforesaid allotments, the paid-up equity share capital of the Company stands increased from Rs. 164,01,29,230/- to Rs. 187,04,86,350 comprising of 18,70,48,635 equity shares of Rs. 10/- each. The promoters holding of 46.46% as on February 29, 2008 also stands revised to 46.97% consequent to the above allotments".

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that in terms of clause 1.8 read with clause 5.1 of the Scheme of Amalgamation ('the Scheme') of Southern Iron and Steel Company Limited (SISCOL) with JSW Steel Limited (JSWSL) and their respective Shareholders & Creditors, the authorised Committee of Directors of JSWSL have fixed Tuesday, the 25th day of March, 2008 as the record date for the purpose of drawing up the list of shareholders of SISCOL to whom Equity shares in JSWSL are to be issued and allotted pursuant to the Scheme sanctioned by the High Court of Judicature at Mumbai. The effective date of the Scheme is March 07, 2008. Further, in terms of the sanctioned Scheme, the Equity Shareholders of the Transferor Company i.e. SISCOL would be issued Equity Shares of JSWSL in the following ratio: "1(One) fully paid up equity share of Rs.10 each of JSWSL shall be issued and allotted for every 22 (Twenty Two) equity shares of Rs.10 each held in SISCOL (hereinafter referred to as "New Equity Shares")". Following implementation of the Scheme & issue of shares as above, the present aggregate equity capital of Rs.164.01 crores of JSWSL will increase by a sum of Rs.15.04 crores.

The 33,799 equity shares allotted as aforesaid shall rank pari passu in all respects with the existing equity shares of the Company. Consequent to the aforesaid allotment the paid-up Equity share capital of the Company stands increased from Rs.163,97,88,130/- to Rs.164,01,26,120/- comprising of 16,40,12,612 equity shares of Rs. 10/- each".

SUBJECT: Scheme of Amalgamation
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited had informed the Exchange that by an order made on November 23, 2007 the Honorable High Court of Judicature at Bombay has directed that a meeting of the equity shareholders and preference shareholders of the Company be held on December 28, 2007 for the purpose of considering and if thought fit, approving with or without modification (s), the arrangement embodied in the Scheme of Amalgamation of Southern Iron & Steel Co. Limited with JSW Steel Limited, The Company has now informed the Exchange that: "a) Mrs. Shobha Mehta, an Equity shareholder of the Company and Mr. Nilesh Shah, a practicing Company Secretary, scrutinisers appointed for the court convened meeting of the equity shareholders; and b) Mr. Sachin Dubey, authorised representative of ICICI Bank Limited, a preference shareholder of the Company and Mrs. Homa Beruz Pouredehi, a High Court Advocate, scrutinisers appointed for the court convened meeting of the preference shareholders have submitted their reports on December 28, 2007 to the Chairman appointed by the Court and the results were announced to the shareholders on December 29, 2007. As per the said Report, the Scheme has been approved by the requisite majority of Equity Shareholders and Preference Shareholders, in number and value, present and voting either in person or proxy, as required by the provisions of Section 391 to 394 of the Companies Act, 1956".

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports on March 06, 2007 that JSW Steel Limited plans to spend around $2 billion on an aluminium project in Andhra Pradesh. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. JSW Steel Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "We clarify that JSW Steel is not taking up any Aluminum project. JSW Aluminum Company Limited belonging to the same group has signed an MOU with State Government of Andhra Pradesh for setting up an Aluminum project in that state. JSW Steel is no way connected with this project."

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports on March 06, 2007 that JSW Steel Limited plans to spend around $2 billion on an aluminium project in Andhra Pradesh. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. SKF India Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "We clarify that JSW Steel is not taking up any Aluminum project. JSW Aluminum Company Limited belonging to the same group has signed an MOU with State Government of Andhra Pradesh for setting up an Aluminum project in that state. JSW Steel is no way connected with this project."

SUBJECT: Miscellaneous
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that "JSW Steel Limited as part of its CDM initiatives developed a 100 MW captive power plants using waste gases as a Clean Development Mechanism (CDM) Projects. This project has been commissioned in April 2005. The company is committed to adopt environment friendly technologies contributing immensely in reducing the green house  gases (GHG) emission. We are pleased to inform you that this project has been registered by CDM Executive Bond of UNFCCC on 12.1.2007. As per the registered project design document, the company is eligible for a total of 7,673,254 Certified Emission Reductions (CER's) from April 2005 till March 2015. Following the registration the company is required to appoint an accredited Verifier for monitoring and verification of the CER's. After this process of verification is completed, the company has to apply to CDM Executive Board of UNFCCC for issuance of CER's. The request for issuance of CERs will then be examined by the CDM Executive Board after following the laid down guidelines and procedures and there after the CER's will be issued. It may be noted that the volume of CER's may vary during this process of monitoring, verification and issuance. These CER's there after can be delivered to the prospective buyers. The price of CER's is volatile and the amount realizable depends upon the market conditions and terms of sale at the time of actual conclusion of sale transactions."

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports on October 25, 2006 that JSW Steel Limited is set to invest Rs. 35,000 crore to set up a 10 million tonne steel plant in Orissa. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. JSW Steel Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "The Company signed a Memorandum of Understanding with the State Govt. of Jharkhand for setting up a 10 MTPA green field steel project in the State of Jharkhand with an investment of Rs. 35,000 Crore which had been communicated by our letter dated 9.11.2005. As a part of the long term strategy, the Company has been looking at expanding its steel capacity further through acquisitions / green field projects / brown field expansions. The Company is engaged in discussions/ correspondence with the State Government of Orissa and State Government of West Bengal for exploring such opportunities for expansion. We clarify that no MOU has so far been signed either in Orissa or West Bengal."

DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Share Allotment Committee of Directors in their meeting held on September 21, 2006 have allotted 5,00,000 (Five Lac) Series A Warrants and 15,00,000 (Fifteen Lac) Series B Warrants to Mr. Sajjan Jindal & 65,00,000 (Sixty Five Lac) Series A Warrants and 65,00,000 (Sixty Five Lac) Series B Warrants to Samarth Holdings Private Limited. Each of these warrants are convertible into Equity shares at the option of the Warrant holders into 1 (one) Equity share of the face value of Rs. 10/- each of the Company at a price of Rs. 272/- (Rs. Two Hundred Seventy Two Only). The 70 Lakh Series A warrants are convertible into Equity Shares on or before March 31, 2007 and the 80 Lakh Series B warrants are convertible into Equity Shares between April 01, 2007 to March 22, 2008. The shareholding of 45.15% held by promoter as on June 30, 2006 will increase to 47.49% on conversion of 70 lakh warrants on or before March 31, 2007 and will further go up by 49.93% on conversion of balance 80 lakh warrants between April 01, 2007 to March 22, 2008.

SUBJECT: Press Release
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange regarding a press release dated September 07, 2006, which is as follows : "JSW Steel Limited announced a price increase of Rs.500/- to Rs.750/- pmt for Hot Dipped Galvanised Products with retrospective effect from September 01, 2006. This price revision primarily accounts for the steep increase of the Zinc prices, a key input raw material for galvanishing, which has increased by almost 10% over last couple of days putting pressure on the bottomline.

SUBJECT: Acquisition
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the company has entered into an Memorandum of Understanding with a Mozambican party (represented through the constituted attorney), who has been allotted prospecting and exploration license for coal and associated minerals in a plot of land measuring total area of 6900 hectares in the province of Tete, in Mozambique. As per the terms of this MoU, JSW Steel is permitted to conduct legal and technical (geological) due diligence studies within a period of 28 weeks to conclude the availability of coal, quality of coal and reserve potential etc. Based on the findings of the due diligence studies, JSW Steel has the option to pursue this opportunity further by carrying out detailed exploration studies, preparing mining plans, initiating steps to obtain mining license and there after mining operations.

SUBJECT: News Verification
DETAILS: News Verification : The media had reports on August 16, 2006 that JSW Steel Limited has acquired a 200 million tonne coal mine in Mozambique. The Exchange, in order to verify the accuracy or otherwise of the information reported in the media and to inform the market place so that the interest of the investors is safeguarded, had written to the officials of the company. JSW Steel Limited has vide its letter inter-alia stated, "JSW Steel has been following the strategy of vertical integration to secure critical raw materials and utilities used in the manufacture of steel. As a part of this strategy, the company is looking at investment in coal mines abroad in various countries namely; Australia, Indonesia, Canada and Mozambique besides making efforts in getting allocation of mines in India itself. In pursuance of these efforts, the company has been evaluating various proposals including investment in coal mines in Mozambique. We clarify that the proposals being looked at by the company are at evaluation stage and no acquisition proposals have been concluded or finalised."

SUBJECT: Preferential Allotment / Others
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that at the Board meeting held on July 25,2006, a preferential issue of Equity warrants to Promoter Group has been approved on the following terms and Conditions, subject to the approval of the Members in an EGM to be convened on September 08,2006 for the purpose: a) Number of warrants :- 1.50 Crore Warrants (9.56% of the existing paid-up equity capital of the company). b) Terms of conversion : - i) Each warrant is convertible into one Equity Share of face value of Rs.10 each at a price to be determined as per SEBI guidelines. ii) 70 Lakh warrants are convertible into Equity Shares on or before March 31,2007. iii) The balance 80 Lakh warrants are convertible into Equity Shares between April 01,2007 to March 22,2008. c) Conversion Price :- To be as per SEBI Guidelines on relevant date. d) Objects of the issue :- The proceeds of the issue will be used for debt reduction and to meet the Capital expenditure / General Corporate Purposes. e) Proposed Allottees :- Samarth Holdings Pvt. Ltd., Mr. Sajjan Jindal. Further, the shareholding of 45.15% held by promoter as on June 30,2006 will increase to 47.49% on conversion of 70 lakh warrants on or before March 31,2007 and will further go up by 49.93% on conversion of balance 80 lakh warrants between April 01,2007 to March 22,2008. Jindal group intends to rise its holding to a reasonable level of comfort (close to 50%) in the current environment of mergers and takeovers happening in the steel industry world over. The proposed preferential allotment is expected to remove the vulnerability of any threat of takeover which will ensure stability of management in the interest of all stakeholders including minority shareholders.

DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that considering the significant interest shown by foreign investors to invest in steel sector due to recent spurt in prices, it has been decided by the Board of Directors at the meeting held on April 19,2006 to consider a comprehensive plan to raise additional resources by way of ADR/GDR or FCCB besides rights issue to finance the capital expenditure programme of the Company. Further, in the light of recent wide fluctuations / volatility in Commodity / Metal prices, turbulent Global / Domestic Stock markets and pending finalization of comprehensive financing plan, the Board of Directors have passed a circular resolution dated June 12,2006 to withdraw the draft letter of offer filed with SEBI and Stock Exchanges on January 25,2006 and all concerned may be intimated accordingly.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that at the Board meeting held on April 19, 2006, the following decisions were taken :  (1) At the Board meeting held on January 20, 2006, it was proposed to issue securities on a right basis not exceeding a sum of Rs.400 crores (excluding proceeds on warrants, 2 warrants for each share subscribed on rights Basis). In view of the significant interest shown by foreign investors to invest in the steel sector due to recent spurt in prices and promising steel Industry outlook, the Directors have decided to consider a comprehensive plan to raise additional resources by way of GDR/ADR or FCCB, besides rights issue of shares with warrants (Shareholders at the AGM held on June 13, 2005  had approved raising of funds through ADR/GDR/FCCB upto USD 500 million).  (2) The Board approved the sale of 60Mega Watt Power Plant in Tamil Nadu to Southern Iron & Steel Company Ltd as a ﾑSlump saleﾒ at a consideration to be determined by an independent valuer. (3) The Company has decided to participate in a Special purpose Vehicle for setting up a 2 x 250 MW power plant at Toranagallu by way of a Joint Venture with JSW Energy Ltd.  The ratio in the Equity participation between JSW Energy Ltd & JSW Steel shall be 74:26.  The contribution towards the 26% Equity is Rs.124.80 Crores. This participation will ensure the Company of continuous power supply for its enhanced capacity being 3.8 MTPA. (3) It has been decided to Shut down the Hot Rolled Mill at Toranagallu, Karnataka for a period of around 30 days for modernization & Capacity enhancement from 2 MTPA to 2.5 MTPA.  This plant will restart operations in the second half of May 2006.  On re-commissioning the quality of the products will improve due to moderisation of plant and the capacity will also go up.

SUBJECT: Rights Issue
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board at its meeting held on Jaunary 20,2006 has pursuant to section 81(1) of the Companies Act, 1956 has approved the issue of Equity Shares with Warrants on Rights basis to the existing shareholders of the Company. The total amount proposed to be raised by Rights issue of equity shares (excluding the amount of equity issue pursuant to conversion of warrants) shall not exceed a sum of Rs. 400 crores. The said Rights issue proceeds shall be utilized for part financing the Cold Rolling Mill Project of one million tpa capacity proposed to be set up at the Company's manufacturing unit at Village Toranagallu, Bellary Dist, Karnataka at an estimated project cost of Rs. 1000 crores. The principal terms and conditions governing the issue of equity shares with warrants on rights basis are as under: The equity shares and warrants will be offered for subscription for cash on a record date (to be decided later) as under: (a) (1) Equity shares for every (8) Equity Shares held as on the Record Date and (1) Series A and (1) Series B Warrants for every fully paid up Equity Share being subscribed and allotted on Rights basis under this issue. (b) Each equity share shall be offered at a price to be determined (including the warrant conversion price) later by a Committee of Directors formed for this purpose. (c) Each warrant will entitle the holder thereof to apply for 1 (one) equity share of Rs. 10/- each at a price and on terms set forth below (i) Warrant Conversion Period for Series A Warrants shall be the period commencing after 18months from the Date of Allotment upto 36 months from the Date of Allotment. The Warrant Conversion Period for Series B Warrants shall be the period commencing after 24 months from the Date of Allotment upto 48 months from the Date of Allotment.

SUBJECT: Record Date
DETAILS: Jsw Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that as per the terms of the Warrants Issued pursuant to the Scheme of Arrangement and Amalgamation between the Company, Jindal Iron and Steel Ltd. and Jindal South West Holdings Limited and their respective members and creditors, the Board of Directors of the Company, at its meeting held on October 20, 2005, has fixed November 07, 2005 as the 'Record Date'. Accordingly, eligible holders shall be entitled to apply for the equity shares the Company by paying Rs.160/- per share (Rs.10 towards the face value and Rs.150 towards the share premium). The Board of Directors has also fixed November 21, 2005 to December 31, 2005 (both days inclusive) as the period within which the Warrant holders should apply for the equity shares as above (Exercise Period). If the entitlement against warrants to apply for shares is not exercised within the Exercise Period, then such Warrants shall expire.

SUBJECT: Date of AGM
DETAILS: Jindal Vijayanagar Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the AGM of the Company has been convened to be held on June 13, 2005.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Jindal Vijayanagar Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held on May 09, 2005, considered and approved the acquisition of Euro Ikon Iron & Steel Private Limited ('Euro Ikon'), Euro Coke & Energy Private Limited ('Euro Coke') and JSW power Limited ('JPL') by way of merger under a Scheme of Amalgamation of Euro Ikon, Euro Coke and JPL with Jindal Vijayanagar Steel Limited ('JVSL') and their respective shareholders under Sections 391 to 394 of the Companies Act, 1956. The Appointed Date for the merger is April 1, 2005.  The Company has further informed that pursuant to the Scheme i) Equity shareholders of Euro Ikon will be allotted 1 equity share of JVSL of Rs.10 each in lieu of 16 equity shares of Rs.10/- each held in Euro Ikon. ii) Equity shareholders of Euro Coke will be allotted 1 equity share of JVSL of Rs.10 each in lieu of 19 equity shares of Rs.10/- each held in Euro Coke; and iii) Equity shareholders of JPL will be allotted 1 equity shares of JVSL of Rs.10 each in lieu of 25 equity shares of Rs.10/- each held in JPL. Following implementation of the Scheme & issue of shares as above, the aggregate equity capital of JVSL will increase by a sum of Rs.17,99,28,360/- consisting of 1,79,92,836 equity shares of Rs.10/- each subject to minor changes upon rounding off of fractional entitlements. The Scheme is subject to requisite consent, approval of the requisite majority of the shareholders, lenders, creditors of the Company, Euro Ikon, Euro Coke and JPL, the Bombay High Court, and the permission or approval of any other statutory or regulatory authorities, which by law may be necessary for the implementation of the Scheme.

Ltd. effective date May 09, 2005.; B) Appointment: Dr. Vijay Kelkar, has been appointed as Additional Director on May 09, 2005.; Mr.Sudipto Sarkar, has been appointed as Additional Director on May 09, 2005. 2. SUBJECT: Change in registered office
DETAILS: Jindal Vijayanagar Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Order of the Company Law Board (CLB), Southern Region Bench, Chennai dated April 26, 2005 for shifting the Company's Registered Office from the State of Karnataka to the State of Maharashtra has been registered by the Registrar of Companies, Karnataka and Registrar of Companies, Maharashtra pursuant to the provisions of Section 18 (3) of the Companies Act, 1956 on April 29, 2005. With this all formalities pertaining to the shifting have been completed and the location of the new Registered Office of the Company as decided by the Board of Directors will be at 'Jindal Mansion', 5A, Dr. G Deshmukh Marg, Mumbai - 400 026 effective April 29, 2005.

SUBJECT: Dividend
DETAILS: Jindal Vijayanagar Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board proposed dividend @ 10% on Cumulative Redeemable Preference shares amounting to Rs. 27.91 crores and Final Dividend on Equity shares @ 50% amounting to Rs. 64.52 crores, subject to the approval of members at the AGM. An interim dividend @ 30% amounting to Rs. 38.71 crores was declared at the Board meeting held on February 10, 2005. The total dividend on Equity shares for the year, if approved, would be @ 80% aggregating to Rs. 103.23 crores.

SUBJECT: Outcome of Board Meeting
DETAILS: Jindal Vijayanagar Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that the Board of Directors of the Company at their meeting held on April 18, 2005 have: 1) Fixed May 03, 2005 to May 06, 2005 (both days inclusive) as Book Closure for the purpose of dividend on Cumulative Redeemable Preference Shares,Dividend on equity shares and for the purpose of AGM. 2) Approved the appointment of ICICI Securities Limited and M/s RSM & Co. as Consultants and the appointment of M/s Deloitte Haskins & Sells and ICICI Securities Limited as Valuers to evaluate the feasibility of acquisition by way of merger of Euro Ikon Iron and Steel Pvt Ltd, Euro Coke and Energy Pvt Ltd and JSW Power Ltd. 3) Approved the issue of Foreign Currency Convertible Bonds (FCCBs)/American Depository Receipts (ADR)/Global Depository Receipts (GDR) upto USD 500 Million subject to requisite approvals including that of the Shareholders.

SUBJECT: Disc under Regulation 13(6)of SEBI Insider Trading Reg.,1992

The details of the sale are as follows: ICICI Bank Limited has sold (i) 5,282,746 equity shares aggregating to 4.09% during the period March 23, 2005 to March 28, 2005; and (ii) 3,068,000 equity shares aggregating to 2.38% on March 31, 2005, of the paid up capital of Jindal Vijayanagar Steel Limited. The shareholding of ICICI Bank Limited after the said sale is 5,114,254 equity shares aggregating to 3.96% of the paid up capital of Jindal Vijayanagar Steel Limited.

SUBJECT: Reg.7(3) of SEBI (Substantial Acq of shares &Takeovers),1997
DETAILS: Jindal Vijayanagar Steel Limited has informed the Exchange that Jindal Thermal Power Company Limited have acquired 41,50,000 shares aggregating to 3.22% of the paid up capital of Jindal Vijayanagar Steel Limited. SUBJECT: Reg.7(1) of SEBI (Substantial Acq of shares &Takeovers),1997
DETAILS: Icici Bank Ltd. has informed the Exchange that pursuant to the sanctioned scheme of arrangement between Jindal Iron and Steel Company and Jindal Viajynagar Steel Limited, the Bank has been allotted 13,465,000 shares amounting to 10.43% of the total paid up capital of Jindal Vijaynagar Steel Company Limited on March 21, 2005. The mode of acquisition is by allotment pursuant to conversion of debt to equity as per CDR scheme and the shareholding of Icici Bank Ltd. after the said allotment is 13,465,000 shares amounting to 10.43% of the total paid up capital of Jindal Vijaynagar Steel Company Limited.

SUBJECT: Disclosure under the SEBI(Prohibition of Insider Trading)
